title: Phenolics-Rich Extract from Agarwood Leaf-Tea Alleviate Dextran Sulfate Sodium (DSS)-Induced Ulcerative Colitis Via Modulating Intestinal Barrier Function, Liver Inflammation, and Gut Microbiota.
abstract: At present, the incidence rate of ulcerative colitis (UC) continues to increase, causing a global burden. In addition, therapeutic drugs have great side effects. According to modern pharmacology, agarwood leaves have anti-inflammatory, antibacterial, hypoglycemic, and lipid-lowering effects. Therefore, this experiment on DSS induced colitis treatment of polyphenolic substances in agarwood leaves is feasible and in line with the current hot topic of using natural substances instead of drugs for treatment.
